node.title: Covid-19 lockdowns leads to lowest job applications, despite record advertisements
node.description: It has been a year of highs and lows for the labour market with record job ad numbers, the lowest ever applications per job ad as the lockdowns unsettled job seekers.

node.title: Father, Son Arrested in California's Raging Caldor Wildfire That Scorched 221k Acres
node.description: The pair are reportedly each being held on $1 million bail.

node.title: Te Pāti Māori won't rule out working with any party
node.description: Te Pāti Māori has left the door open to work with the National Party and its new leader Christopher Luxon.

node.title: Covid-19: Rapid antigen testing to be free for some domestic travellers
node.description: The Ministry of Health has released more details on what free Covid-19 rapid antigen testing will mean for those crossing regional boundaries over summer.

node.title: Hillary Clinton Reads Discarded Victory Speech From 2016 Election
node.description: Mrs. Clinton read the long-shelved speech aloud for her offering on MasterClass, a site featuring lessons from prominent figures in the arts, business and other fields.

node.title: Cop Suspended, Accused of Going Deer Hunting With Convicted Felon in Patrol Car
node.description: The off-duty cop is accused of using the patrol car for deer hunting with other people, including one with a prior conviction who wasn't allowed to have a gun.

node.title: France releases Saudi man mistakenly held over Khashoggi killing
node.description: France has released a Saudi man arrested over suspected links to the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi after officials concluded it was a case of mistaken identity.

node.title: Wellington council looks at incentives for quake-prone building owners to meet deadline
node.description: A survey trying to determine what compliance progress building owners had made so far only got a reply from 40 percent of those sent questions.

node.title: 'A testament to highly responsive community mobilisation': Pacific vaccination milestone praised
node.description: Auckland's eligible Pacific population has successfully hit 90 percent first dose vaccinations across all three of the city's DHBs.

node.title: ‘Kimberly Akimbo’ Review: What’s an Anagram for ‘Wonderful’?
node.description: Victoria Clark stars in a playful yet powerful musical about a girl who is aging too fast among adults who behave like children.

node.title: North Carolina Supreme Court Delays 2022 Primary Elections
node.description: In response to lawsuits over North Carolina’s political maps, the justices issued an order on Wednesday pushing back the state’s primaries from March to May.

node.title: House Votes 428-1 Against Uyghur Forced Labor; Lone Holdout Is Republican Thomas Massie
node.description: The bill requires corporations to provide "clear and convincing evidence" that regional imports from Xinjiang aren't manufactured through forced labor.

node.title: PA Health System Runs Out of Beds Due to COVID Surge, Patients Wait 10 to 20 Hours in ER
node.description: Geisinger is operating at 110 percent capacity in its nine hospitals located in central and northeastern Pennsylvania, with most COVID patients unvaccinated.

node.title: GOP Elections Leader in Utah Says Members Trying to 'Fundamentally Destroy the Voting System'
node.description: A Republican-led committee of lawmakers in the state where Trump won 58 percent of the vote has approved an audit of the state's election system.

node.title: Transport Agency's highways plan to hike-up emissions - lobby group
node.description: A transport lobby group says the National Land Transport Programme (NLTP) will see carbon emissions climb even higher and wants it scrapped and redone.

node.title: Stubbed out: Cigarette sales to be banned for younger generations
node.description: New world-first laws will ensure young people will never legally purchase cigarettes, with the age of a ban on sales rising each year, the minister says.

node.title: 'Disappointed and upset': Ardern on GP giving out 'vaccine exemption'
node.description: The Prime Minister says it is disappointing and upsetting a GP is reportedly handing out certificates as vaccine exemptions as it puts others at risk. Audio

node.title: Instagram CEO says it's "critical" to have multi-platform youth safety rules
node.description: Instagram CEO Adam Mosseri told a Senate subcommittee investigating the harmful effects of the photo sharing app on teenagers that "keeping young people safe online is not just about one company."

node.title: I’m Furious at the Unvaccinated
node.description: They don’t only leave themselves vulnerable to the virus, they make everyone more vulnerable.

node.title: Woman Stole Daughter’s Identity to Get Loans and Attend College, U.S. Says
node.description: Laura Oglesby, 48, of Missouri, who pleaded guilty to intentionally providing false information to the Social Security Administration, lived as someone nearly half her age, the authorities said.

node.title: Michigan County Has Charged 18 Youths Ages 12 to 17 for Making Threats Against Schools
node.description: Wayne County Prosecutor Kym Worthy said 18 students have been charged with making threats in the week since a school shooting that killed 4 in the state.

node.title: 7 Members of Suspended Fraternity Arrested for Cyberstalking Student Who Reported Hazing
node.description: According to Lafayette County Justice Court records, they were arrested Friday after turning themselves in. They were released on a bond of $5,000 each.

node.title: International trade shows strong growth after setback last year
node.description: International trade has bounced back from the pandemic, with strong growth over the past year.

node.title: Consumer NZ to test products for sustainability and repairability
node.description: Consumer New Zealand says it's making the biggest change to its product testing process in more than 50 years of existence - by only recommending appliances that last. Audio

node.title: Intensifying strategic competition leading to risk of conflict in Indo-Pacific - report
node.description: A new defence report identifies 'China's rise' and its power struggle with the United States as one of the pre-eminent security risks in the Indo-Pacific. Audio

node.title: Watch: Christopher Luxon speaks to media in Christchurch
node.description: National Party leader Christopher Luxon has spoken to media after visiting Christchurch Boys' High School.

node.title: Man jailed for shooting and injuring police officer
node.description: A man who shot and injured a police officer at a routine traffic stop in Hamilton in July has been jailed for seven years and eight months.

node.title: Otago council ramps up campaign against rabbits
node.description: Lax Otago landowners will soon have to foot the bill if the regional council has to step in and deal with their rabbit problems.

node.title: Some in California have to limit their daily water usage. Here's what that means
node.description: A 10-minute shower uses about 25 gallons of water. One load of laundry uses 40 gallons.

node.title: Police in one Wisconsin city want to reduce crime by becoming a neighbor
node.description: Six houses in Racine, Wisconsin, are staffed by police, whose job it is to get to know the communities they serve.
